page.title: 01SELBY THE TOWN AND AREA
page.content: SELBY IS A MARKET TOWN.THE POPULATION IS APPROXIMATELY 15000.IT LIES ON THE RIVER OUSE ABOUT 14 MILES FROM YORK AND 18 MILES FROM LEEDS AND DONCASTER.IT IS ONLY VERY SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEA LEVEL AND VERY OFTEN FLOODS BECAUSE THE RIVER IS TIDAL. SELBY HAS A TWIN TOWN IN FRANCE CALLED CARENTAN. SELBY HAS A VERY POPULAR MARKET EACH MONDAY AND ATTRACTS MANY PEOPLE FROM AROUND. SELBY HAS A BUSY SHIPYARD AND PRODUCES MANY SHIPS INCLUDING CROSS CHANNEL FERRIES.IN 1985 THE DUCHESS OF KENT LAUNCHED A LARGE FERRY CALLED THE HEBRIDIAN ISLANDS. THERE IS A VERY FAMOUS ABBEY IN THE CENTRE OF TOWN.THE ABBEY IS CALLED THE ABBEY CHURCH OF SAINT GERMAIN AND MARY.
